text: Challenge: find programming languages that are not Turing complete! I’ll start with RegExp.

elements.text: Challenge: find programming languages that are not Turing complete! I’ll start with RegExp.

text: HTML5 + CSS3 is apparently Turing complete though :)

elements.text: HTML5 + CSS3 is apparently Turing complete though :)

text: I think most domain specific languages are not turing complete. Not sure if they qualify as programming languages though :thinking_face:

elements.text: I think most domain specific languages are not turing complete. Not sure if they qualify as programming languages though

text: Since you started with RegExp (deterministic finite automata): nondeterministic pushdown automata are not turing-complete either

elements.text: Since you started with RegExp (deterministic finite automata): nondeterministic pushdown automata are not turing-complete either

text: I’ll add the APEX language in Salesforce, which looks a lot like Java. I claim it’s not Turing complete because the execution is limited by time and other factors. Does this limitation count in Turing completeness?

elements.text: I’ll add the APEX language in Salesforce, which looks a lot like Java. I claim it’s not Turing complete because the execution is limited by time and other factors. Does this limitation count in Turing completeness?

text: Code-a-pillar reminds me of the electronics building toolkit I had as a child. I don’t remember the name, but it had square blocks with an electronic component inside, contacts on all sides, and you plugged them to a box of sorts with power etc. on the inside edges. You could build mostly just the stuff in the manual.

elements.text: Code-a-pillar reminds me of the electronics building toolkit I had as a child. I don’t remember the name, but it had square blocks with an electronic component inside, contacts on all sides, and you plugged them to a box of sorts with power etc. on the inside edges. You could build mostly just the stuff in the manual.

text: My friend had that toolkit too! It was my greatest christmas gift for years, but I never got it :slightly_smiling_face:

elements.text: My friend had that toolkit too! It was my greatest christmas gift for years, but I never got it

text: The blocks yes, with electrical symbols on top.

elements.text: The blocks yes, with electrical symbols on top.

text: I have to say I learned nothing from it, but it was cool. I learned more at school once when we were experimenting with resistors, I applied too much voltage, and the smoke came out. :innocent:

elements.text: I have to say I learned nothing from it, but it was cool. I learned more at school once when we were experimenting with resistors, I applied too much voltage, and the smoke came out.
